bjpack

Class BJPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • bjpack.BJPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class BJPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    BJPanel() is the GUI for this game. It hold all of the graphical elements and contains the Main() method that creates the game and runs it.
    Author:
    Logan Crowe
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void disableButtons()
      Disables the appropriate buttons.
      private void endGame(Game game)
      endGame() is called in a 'end game' situation and calls the appropriate methods to generate values needed to complete and display to the user's end message and winnings total.
      private static javax.swing.ImageIcon getIcon(Card card)
      Get's the appropriate ImageIcon based on the parameter Card() object's card rank and value.
      private void initialize(Game game)
      Sets up the initial GUI based on the given Game() object.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Launch the application.
      private void newGame(Game oldgame)
      Makes a new game using the old game's point total to carry forward.
      private void refreshCards(Game game)
      Refreshes the card icons based on the current card values.
      private void refreshGame(Game game)
      Refreshes the game's GUI elements.
      private void refreshToolbar(Game game)
      Refreshes the game's tool bar.
      private void resizeImages()
      This method takes in all the necessary image files, re-sizes them, and then assigns them to the appropriate ImageIcon.

      • emptyImg

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage emptyImg
        There are 54 BufferedImage object to take in the 54 images need to for a complete deck, including a card back and an empty card space for when no cards exist in that spot. The BufferedImages will be passed as a resize BufferedImage and then passed again as an ImageIcon.

        Returns:
        ImageIcon for the card.

      • newGame

        private void newGame(Game oldgame)
        Makes a new game using the old game's point total to carry forward.
        Parameters:
        oldgame - previous Game() object, to be used for point total.

      • endGame

        private void endGame(Game game)
        endGame() is called in a 'end game' situation and calls the appropriate methods to generate values needed to complete and display to the user's end message and winnings total.
        Parameters:
        game - current game that is ending.
